Fun Stuff
Trivia:The scene where Princess Regina trips over her bed sheets was not scripted, Jeannette Weegar really did trip and fall, but the director liked it so it was kept and put in the final cut. more 
Goofs:Continuity: When Jamal is introduced by the dwarf before he talks about "Jamal in the Box" he has his pocket on his shirt to cover the logo underneath, but when he asks if anyone has had a froth-a-chino it is gone to reveal the logo and then the very next shot it is back on there again more

User Comments   (Comment on this title) 
45 out of 64 people found the following comment useful:- 
Garbage, 13 April 2003


Author: howdymax from Las Cruces, New Mexico 

My wife and I worked as extras on this movie for almost 2 months. This entire review is devoted to Martin Lawrence. I have done more than 30 productions and never experienced the kind of treatment I received on this one. Let me list a few. The director, Gil Junger would rehearse a scene for hours only to overridden by Martin when he finally showed up on the set. Martin had a group of bodyguards that would push us all out of the way when he came on the set because he didn&#039;t like to be touched. His doubles did most of his work. I give special credit to a fellow named Nixon who seemed to do most of the work. Martin only did closeups. He had a girl whose job it was to put on his scarf and earmuffs. He had a guy who followed him around to put a chair under him if he wanted to sit down. This is the most negative review I have ever written, but Martin Lawrence needs to be exposed for who he really is. 

Anyone who worked with him will agree.
